nodes.bodyText: Is there a specific reason to use Import-Package instead of Require-Bundle?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -3,18 +3,18 @@ Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2
 Bundle-Name: %pluginName
 Bundle-SymbolicName: org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search;singleton:=true
 Bundle-Version: 1.4.0.qualifier
-Bundle-Activator: org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search.CapellaUISearchPlugin
+Bundle-Activator: org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search.Activator
 Bundle-Vendor: %providerName
-Require-Bundle: com.google.guava,
- org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.toolkit,
- org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator,
- org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.semantic.browser,
- org.polarsys.capella.common.tools.report.appenders.reportlogview,
- org.polarsys.capella.common.re.gen,
- org.eclipse.sirius,
- org.eclipse.core.expressions,
- org.eclipse.ui.ide
 Bundle-RequiredExecutionEnvironment: JavaSE-1.8
-Export-Package: org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search,
- org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search.handler
 Bundle-Localization: plugin
+Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.search,
+ org.eclipse.jface.text,
+ org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.ui.navigator,
+ org.polarsys.capella.common.ui.toolkit,
+ org.eclipse.sirius.common.ui,
+ org.polarsys.capella.core.sirius.ui,
+ org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor
+Export-Package: org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search
+Import-Package: org.polarsys.capella.common.ui.toolkit.viewers.data

nodes.bodyText: Avoid using variables with underscore in their names (for Sonar)
Deque, the unsynchronized version of Stack, should be used to be more performance efficient.
This has not been finished, isn't it?

nodes.bodyText: Remove unused imports. There are many of them.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,389 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 THALES GLOBAL SERVICES.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+ *  
+ * Contributors:
+ *    Thales - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;

nodes.bodyText: Could you try to abstract this class and CapellaReplaceHistory to have a common class since they have a lot in common?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,164 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 THALES GLOBAL SERVICES.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+ *  
+ * Contributors:
+ *    Thales - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.search;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.List;
+
+import org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.IDialogSettings;
+
+public class CapellaSearchSettingsHistory {

nodes.bodyText: Could you avoid using deprecated methods if possible in this class (e.g. setSorter)?

There are some problems with this class. It not only recreates images but also maintains a map of ImageDescriptor which is already done with the ExtendedImageRegistry. This causes performance issue and code redundancy. Moreover, it's not generic. Capella's elements are treated separately than diagram elements, viewpoint elements, etc.
IMO, there are 2 solutions: 1) Create dummy objects of eClasses just to get their label and image (using EObjectLabelProviderHelper). We've already done this in Capella in org.polarsys.capella.core.ui.metric.actions.MetricAction.
2) More complicated but I think feasible. Contribute a new class (e.g. EClassLabelProviderHelper) to get label and image from EClass. From an EClass we can get the Package URI and then get the ItemProviderAdapterFactory (contributed via org.eclipse.emf.edit.itemProviderAdapterFactories extension point). From the ItemProviderAdapterFactory we can determine the .edit bundle (e.g. org.polarsys.capella.core.data.gen.edit in Capella). With the bundle we can get the image (like what you've done) with ExtendedImageRegistry.INSTANCE.getImageDescriptor. For the label, we can inspire from the method org.eclipse.emf.common.EMFPlugin.InternalHelper.getString(String, boolean).
